item.title: Attempted Trump assassination trial begins. And, South Korea to fly 300 workers home
item.description: Jury selection begins today in the trial of the man charged with attempting to assassinate Trump last year. And, South Korea plans to bring home more than 300 workers who were detained by ICE agents.

item.title: Leni Riefenstahl made movies for Hitler. A new documentary digs through her archives
item.description: Adolf Hitler commissioned filmmaker Leni Riefenstahl to make propaganda about Nazi Germany. She lived to be 101 years old and denied knowing about the Holocaust.

item.title: Shooting attack at Jerusalem bus stop kills at least 5
item.description: Paramedics said at least five people were killed in a shooting attack in Jerusalem after two attackers opened fire at a bus stop at a busy intersection in north Jerusalem.

item.title: 20 years ago, New Orleans fired its teachers. It's been rebuilding ever since
item.description: When New Orleans schools reopened after Katrina, most of the city's educators didn't get their jobs back. Instead, they were often replaced with young people who were new to town — and new to teaching.

item.title: World Cup ticket sales are about to begin. Scoring them may not be easy — or cheap
item.description: FIFA is set to launch the first window of regular ticket sales for the 2026 World Cup on Wednesday. Brace yourself: because they may not be easy to get — or cheap.

item.title: Alone in a foreign country, a young woman is saved by two strangers

item.title: What kind of dairy does a body good? Science is updating the answer
item.description: New dietary guidelines are coming soon. Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has promised the days of skim milk and other low-fat dairy products are over. Is there a case for more fat in dairy?

item.description: Ryan Routh was arrested after a Secret Service agent spotted him holding a gun and fired on him when Trump was golfing at his West Palm Beach golf club in September. He faces up to life in prison.
